comments.body:
It's hard to say whether this static_cast does the right thing.  `Base` can be a number of classes and each one has its own (frequently multiple) inheritance chain.

Not a fan of `StreamBase`, in case you're wondering.

It definitely didn't work when I converted the returned `void*` to `StreamBase`. Hence why I first case to `Base`. I think this replicates what was happening before with `StreamBase* wrap = Unwrap<Base>()`. If you can think of a better way to ensure it casts properly I'll be happy to change it.

Duly notes. :)

Not use multiple inheritance, it makes it hard to reason about code. =)

This change is fine, we'll just hope and assume it keeps on working.
